body_html: No, I don't think so. DecodeGif always returned 4D tensor. decode_image in python was added after that, and always returned a 4D for GIF and 3D for png or jpg. So nm on what I wrote earlier about having it always return frame 0.
body_text: No, I don't think so.  DecodeGif always returned 4D tensor.  decode_image in python was added after that, and always returned a 4D for GIF and 3D for png or jpg.  So nm on what I wrote earlier about having it always return frame 0.
body: No, I don't think so.  DecodeGif always returned 4D tensor.  decode_image in python was added after that, and always returned a 4D for GIF and 3D for png or jpg.  So nm on what I wrote earlier about having it always return frame 0.
